intro: Stachys kurdica, commonly known as Kurdish betony, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of the Middle East and Central Asia. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which is characterized by square stems and aromatic leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring opposite, lance-shaped leaves with hairy surfaces. Its flowers are clustered in whorls along the stem, producing purple to violet blooms that attract pollinators. Stachys kurdica is often found in rocky or gravelly soils and is valued for its ornamental appeal and traditional medicinal uses.
